fr:frontmatter.fr:title: On the structure of the \mathrm {GL}_{2} of a ring

fr:title.text: Derived subgroup of general linear group

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Derived subgroup of general linear group

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: We can relate the commutator subgroup of \mathrm {GL}_{n}(R) to \mathrm {SL}_{n}(R) under certain circumstances on n and R. For skew-fields, the derived subgroup is equal to the elementary linear group.

fr:li.fr:p: Let R be a unital ring of finite stable rank \mathrm {sr}(R). Then for every n>\mathrm {sr}(R) we have [\mathrm {GL}_{n}(R),\mathrm {GL}_{n}(R)]=\mathrm {EL}_{n}(R).
This follows from Vaserstein's injective stability theorem (theorem 10.15 in B. Magurn, An Algebraic Introduction to K-Theory, CUP, 2002).

Bass proved this is true for any (associative) unital ring R when n\geq 3. See arXiv:1510.07143. Further when R is commutative, n=1 has [\mathrm {GL}_{1}(R),\mathrm {GL}_{1}(R)]=\mathrm {EL}_{1}(R). For more about the n=2 case, see Cohn's "On the structure of the \mathrm {GL}_{2} of a ring".
In particular, for any field \mathbb {F}, we have [\mathrm {GL}_{n}(\mathbb {F}),\mathrm {GL}_{n}(\mathbb {F})]=\mathrm {EL}_{n}(\mathbb {F}) when either n\neq 2 or \mathbb {F}\neq \mathbb {F}_{2}.
